item.title: Why Satoshi Nakamoto's Identity Matters - CoinDesk
item.description:
Why Satoshi Nakamoto's Identity Matters - CoinDesk

In this opinion piece, Schuil argues that the identity of bitcoin's creator could have a great impact not only on the technology, but potentially the future of the world's economy. Lots has been said (and even more has been speculated) following Craig Wright's claim that he is bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto.

item.title: Netopia: Bitcoin Volume in Romania has Exceeded 1 Million Euro
item.description:
Netopia: Bitcoin Volume in Romania has Exceeded 1 Million Euro

Bitcoin transactions in Romania have crossed the 1 million euro mark. The market size of new age financial solutions sees a steady increase. Read more... The Bitcoin ecosystem in Romania is reportedly experiencing a steady growth. According to Antonio Eram, the CEO of Romania's leading mobile payment solutions provider Netopia, the Bitcoin volume is the country has recently surpassed the €1 million mark.

item.title: Web Summit to Host Two-Day FinTech Event in Madrid
item.description:
Web Summit to Host Two-Day FinTech Event in Madrid

On 21 and 22 June over 1,500 people from the world of fintech will come to Nave Boetticher, Madrid to take part in MoneyConf. This invite­ only event is being brought to Madrid by the organisers of the world's largest startup event Web Summit. Disclaimer: This is a press release.

item.title: Smart Contracts May Need To Play By Dumb Rules
item.description:
Smart Contracts May Need To Play By Dumb Rules

Smart contracts seem to become the norm these days, although there is an argument to be made as to how "smart" these contracts truly are. While there is a certain attribute of efficiency to be gained, there is the question of whether people can make these contracts behave as intended in the real world.

item.title: What Makes Japan Second Largest Bitcoin Market, Potentially First
item.description:
What Makes Japan Second Largest Bitcoin Market, Potentially First

Having overtaken the US, Japan has become the world's second Bitcoin market, after China. Will the Empire of the Sun move ahead of all to completely embrace digital assets? Japan has recently overtaken the United States to become the world's second largest Bitcoin market.

item.title: Andreas Antonopoulos Blocks Bitcoinist on Twitter After "Hit Job Story"
item.description:
Andreas Antonopoulos Blocks Bitcoinist on Twitter After "Hit Job Story"

Andreas Antonopoulos Blocks Bitcoinist on Twitter After "Hit Job Story" ​Within the Bitcoin community, there are frequently disagreements and issues regarding a matter of opinion. Communication and dialogue usually can cure any and all such problems, at least keeping them from boiling over.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's Our Weekend Strategy - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Here's Our Weekend Strategy - NEWSBTC

Here's what we are looking at for the weekend sessions in the bitcoin price So that's it - the end of the week. We've had some considerable up and down swings in the bitcoin price since Monday, and as we mentioned in the first of our twice daily bitcoin price watch pieces this morning, we've been able to get in and out for a profit on a couple of occasions.

item.title: Scientific Research Needs a Trustless Blockchain Architecture to Be Trusted
item.description:
Scientific Research Needs a Trustless Blockchain Architecture to Be Trusted

Dr. Greg Irving, a Clinical Lecturer from the University of Cambridge, recently authored a research project on the potential impact of blockchain technology on scientific research. While the use is not novel in principle, it underscores the very reason blockchain was created.

item.title: Microsoft Joins Blockchain-Focused Chamber of Digital Commerce
item.description:
Microsoft Joins Blockchain-Focused Chamber of Digital Commerce

Microsoft has joined the Chamber of Digital Commerce. What difference would this bring to blockchain adoption? Recently Microsoft has announced that it has joined the Chamber of Digital Commerce, a trade association focused on promoting distributed ledger technology. What difference would this bring to blockchain adoption?

item.title: Japan's TechBureau Raises $6.5 Million for Bitcoin and Blockchain Services - CoinDesk
item.description:
Japan's TechBureau Raises $6.5 Million for Bitcoin and Blockchain Services - CoinDesk

A Japanese blockchain startup has raised ¥720m (or just over $6.5m) in a new Series A funding round. TechBureau, which operates a bitcoin exchange called Zaif and a permissioned blockchain platform named Mijin, netted the investment from a group of investors.
